intro: Blepharis spiculifolia, commonly known as the spike-leaved bluemouth, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually pale blue or purple, and it produces small, cylindrical seed capsules. Blepharis spiculifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
